text: 750 ml bottle at OConnors. Cloudy amber with big white head. Aroma is herby, grassy, flowers and light alcohol. Taste is similar, complex, blonde-ish notes, herbs, flowers, alcohol with a yeasty slight phenoly finish.

Bottle from Smakpiwa.pl. Piwo ma piekna barwe najpierw bursztynowa po dolaniu calej masy osadu metna w kolorze niemal kakao. Piana srednia i srednio trwala. W smaku figi, daktyle, troche kasztanow jadalnych i ta moja ulubiona drewniano kwaskowa nuta towarzyszaca za kazdym przelknieciem. Syropowato figowe piwo ze spora dawka nut wiejskich i kwaskowych posmakow.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, orange, figs, hops, citrus and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque amber/orange beer with heavy yeast and with a medium/large off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, orange and figs; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus and spices.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Feels like a mix between a regular Belgian ale and a Saison. That fig juice adds a mostly sweet flavour and a very slight tart that I would simply describe with spices. A great appearance and palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.

750 ml caged and corked bottle, no date I could find on it. Served in a Blaugies chalice, the beer pours an orange/amber color with a couple inch off-white head that stuck around for a while. Theres a small amount of lacing. Aroma is nice and earthy, the brew smells like wheat/grainy malt, grassiness, figs, peppery spice and some citrus. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some white grape and apple (both sweet and tart) flavors noticeable too. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its high but soft carbonation makes it creamy, smooth and easy to drink. I think this is a good overall brew, I liked it. Certainly worth picking up!

F: big, egg-white, average retention.
C: gold, hazy.
A: malt, orange peels, spicy, bit of lemon, basement, fruity sourness, touch of vinegar.
T: malt, dry fruity, spicy, lemon peels, medium body, medium carbonation, very good rates here but for me nothing special, sample from tap @ ZBF 2017 Leuven.
Bottle at Tana a Bruxelles. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is figs, wild yeast, a bit vineous. Taste is figs, vineous, quite watery, a bit peppery, dry finish. high carbonation. Quite nice!

Bottle at La Tana a Bruxelles. Pours cloudy amber, actually a gusher. Aroma is light booze, lightly herbal and floral. Body is medium, crisp carbonation, quite sweet, a bit boozy still. Palate has carbonation, bitterness and booze. Good.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: hay and saison yeast. Grassy notes. Taste: medium body with hay and sourness hint. Good attenuation and very drinkable. Aftertaste: hay and saison yeast. Good.
Not sure how much fig juice or flavors Im getting with this but otherwise its nice.

0.75 l bottle from Rudat, best before December 2018. Clear, amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish-sourish, moderately fruity, slightly grassy-spicy, a bit funky-dusty aroma of lemon peel, hay and dark fruits (figs). A bit sour, quite fruity, moderately grassy-spicy and a little funky taste of lemon, gooseberry, figs, oak and hints of white grapes, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, slightly grassy-spicy and very dry finish. Thin to medium body, moderately astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very interesting, really refreshing, I like it!

Bottle in the Salt Horse, Edinburgh shared with Pix. Golden with a foamy off white head. Funky aroma with Belgian yeast notes. The taste has mildly sour light cider notes along with grain. Refreshing and pleasant.

Bouteille. Robe orangée foncée et trouble avec un petit dépôt au fond du verre et un col de mousse mince et rocailleux. Arômes de levures belges, jus de fruits suret, citron et son zeste, orange. En bouche, jus de figues, citron, levures légères, sucre à glacer. Très doux en bouche, le coté saison est bien caché par le fruit. Texture huileuse et juteuse, corps mince à moyen.
Bottle in the salt horse in Edinburgh. Pours golden and slightly hazy with a nice cream head. Nose is a little bit largery. Taste is lots of golden syrup and a bit of bret. Nice.

750ml bottle (Pothouse, Tallinn)
Opens with a big pop, but all under control, thank you. Bright orange, brief head. First sniff was alas a bit of tinned tomato, but thats replaced by something more recogniseable fruit juiciness. Some almost lambicky sourness too, a saisony funk. Palate way too fizzy. Taste is sweet, some rice pudding, fruit juice. Gets heavier in the rice pudding aspect as it continues, even coconut milk slickness. Finish dry and bitter. Bit of a dull brew.

750ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Cloudy dark amber color. Small size, yellowish-beige head, stays. Apples, fruity, yeasty, CO2, metallic and yeasty in aroma. Sweetish, honey, apples, earthy and fizzy in taste. Apples, yeasty and some jammy notes in aftertaste. Fizzy carbonation. Feels dirty and messy. And fizzy. And farmhousey. Weird brew.

Large offwhite creamy head. Good lacing. Mostly diminishing. Dark amber average-density clear body. Aroma: metal, fig, moderate malt, citrus lemon. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: light acidic moderate sweet; long duration. Palate: light medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation, moderate astringent finish. Delicioso balanço entre dulçor frutado e acidez lembrando ameixa fresca. Leve presença de malte no fundo. 80s

Bottle in Les Vigneronnes in Rome-Italy, with Paolo (Luppolo Station) and Antonio (Les Vigneronnes). Clear ancient golden pour, medium head with good retention. Nose is sweet and feels like jam, figs certainly but also a pinch of caramel. Mouth is clean, silky, sweet a bit and easy drinking in its complexity. Very tasty.
Fruchtig herber Beginn, hintergründige Säure. Dezent bitter, spritzig, hell würzig. Sehr süffig. 8/10/11/11/10/11
750ml Bottle - Amber with a foamy head. Pear, figs and apple in the aroma. Fruity, spicy and fairly sweet taste. Sultanas, figs, spice and caramel. Bit too sweet for me.
backlog. Cloudy golden. Aroma has peppery notes, with noble hops, gras and slight fig notes. Palate is balanced, figs are not overpowering. Complex

Cloudy golden with rich head and lots of sediment. Fruity,lightly raisiny aroma. Sweetish with pleasant malt and yeast character. The body is however a bit thin, an the character of the fig juice and hardly noticable. Subtle, and a bit lacking in body
Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Aroma of yeast and grass mostly. Taste has soft dry yeast, grass and some herbs. Saison like.
Bottle from Tanakaya. Fig juice, eh? Creamy wheaty, great stuff, light cherry fruitiness, very smooth, great stuff.

Bottle sample from notes. Pours a hazy orange color with a large fluffy off white head. The aroma and flavor have tart fruit, figs, raisins, floral notes, pale malts, some earthy character, funk, yeast, decent.
On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy gold with large thick off white head that lasts. The aroma is yeast, spice, dark fruit, wood. Medium body, yeast, fig, spice, light finish, decent.
Bottle from Cornelius. Rich orange, big white head. Funky farmyard and sweetness. Medium body, full carb. Yeasty and spicy loveliness.

Bottle. Hazy orange beer, big fizzy white head. Fruity nose, some barnyard, caramel, spice notes. Flavor is fruity with tart notes, some acidity, sweetness. Barnyard kicks in in the finish along with yeast and spice notes. Crisp carbonation. Pretty refreshing.
Interesting, different, good. Smooth saison-style sour fiinish, excellent head, nice texture, etc. Fig is slight but adds to the richness here.One of the most interesting to be had in Estonia

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Hazy amber body with a thin off-white head that fades. Steady carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of fig, caramel and earth. Flavour of bread, light salted caramel and peanuts. Thin body with a watery texture. Light fizz. Its very thin and light but theres a nice rustic flavour to this.

Keg at hanging bat... Hazy copper... Thin off white head... Soft toffee yeasty herbal fruit nose... Over fizzy.. Big bready yeasty front... Soft toffee.. Light fig fruit... But nedds to warm up and def be less fizzy

Feb. 16. A 0.75 l bottle that poured lightly hazy deep golden body with medium sized, nice yellow hued head. Lightly sour aroma, cidery, fresh, fruity, but weak. Flavor was lightly sour, too, with subtle notes of apples, figs (I was right now when I read the commercial) and spices. However, it was all weak, unimpressive with watery, thin body and almost non existent, mildly sour finish. Seemed like some stupid experiment like saison-sour? Now it makes more sense from the description, but its still a waste of money. Unless youll pretend to enjoy it when you already paid, what, 20 euro...

Some light bretta and a little barnyard funk. A hint of bubblegum and old hay. Golden pour with great head and lacing. Tangy finish with some citrus. Good balance, and interesting. Tap at The Sovereign.

Bottle (from Koht, Tallinn). Pours amber with huge beige head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, apricots, malt, some sweetness. Flavor is sweet and sour, fruity, apricots, citrus, some alcohol. Overall: good.

Feige schmeck ich zwar nicht, aber ansonsten ist dieses mit mit einem üppigen Korpus ausgestattet, der am auffälligsten durch seine Milde besticht. Säure & Würze spielt auch einen Rolle. Interessant. 0,1/1Jetson beim ZYTHOS BEER FESTIVAL 2016 in Leuven.

Hazy dark yellow with low head. aroma is sweetish, completed, not so strong and only a bit old. Some fruits and flowers. Taste is strongly sourish, old apples, light juice, water, birch juice, sour fruits. Nice!

Dégustée en accompagnement dune salade de concombres sunomono et dun filet de morue citronné. Couleur ambrée, robe non filtrée, mousse abondante et non persistante. Un nez qui verse dans la levure gomme balloune, le poivre blanc, des fleurs jeunes et fraîchement ouvertes. Des arômes printaniers, emballés dans cette levure Belge que je connais par coeur et que jaffectionne tout autant. Un corps presque moyen, presque mince; aérien. Les bulles qui explosent dans ma bouche allègent considérablement le tout et confèrent à ce liquide typiquement Belge, une minéralité qui lui va à ravir. Saveurs peu complexes mais peu me chaud. Une délicate figue me salue de la main sans toutefois faire de bruit, accompagnée de cette levure a qui on a confié le premier rôle. Des raisins rouges à larrière-goût et des notes délicatement boisées. On apprécie cette bière pour sa délicatesse et son agréable compagnie.
De nouveau une très belle bière tout en fraîcheur et en fruit, la bouche est finement acidulée et dune belle longueur, la finale est raffraîchissante. Une bière de plaisir.

At Mrks. Bottle courtesy of Maakun. Hazy pale orange/ darkngolden. Little head. Figs reprazent! Figgy bizzness, caramel. Fruity sweet, very light sour and salty. Some mineral/chrystal texture going on. Interesting table beer, bit like a gose, also makes me think of medieval times. Like!

Big bottle shared. Slight hazy dark golden with short lasting bubbly white head. Sour fruits, rotten mango, figs, quite dusty, cotton, dank cellar notes, rotten weeds, light grains and herbs. Light sweet and sour with soft herbal bitter finish. Medium bodied with nice mouth coating carbonation. Quite nice, but a bit too dusty.
75cl bottle from etre gourmet. Hazy dark orange color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, low sweetness. Aroma is malty, fruity, spicy, juicy, grassy.
Overall: Sweet bread, sour lemon peel. Cardamom, yeast.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-02-23.

A bit hazy amber colour. Medium white head. Fruity, acidic, juicy, refreshing aroma. Sour, fruity beginning. Reminds a bit home made beers, because of hints of dark bread and raisins in the middle. But it is interesting. Sour, fruity finish. Light bodied, medium carbonated, refreshing and interesting brew. Worth to taste and enjoy.

Pours an amber body with a medium head. Fruity aroma. Taste is a bit weird for a beer, it is probably the fig juice. It isnt bad in any way, just not whats expected. The taste does however go very well with the rest of the beer and balances well. In other word, interesting :)

W aromacie początkowo uderzenie brettów, mocno wiejsko, prawie jak lambic, z czasem więcej nut saisona, owocowych, dominuje słodka, czerwona pomarańcza - jest dobrze! W smaku wytrawnie, na poły soczyście (pomarańcza, brzoskwinia), na poły zbożowo, mocno nagazowane przy całkiem sporej pełni, leciutka kwaskowość owocowa - pewnie skutek użycia fig. Pijalne, bardzo smaczne!

13 oz pour on draft at The Sovereign, served in a snifter. Hazy dark orange with off-white head. Aromas of figs, spices, herbs. Tastes of figs, spices, citrus, herbs, stone fruit, dark fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Figs are quite prominent.

Âmbar alaranjado, levemente turva, espuma de pouca formação e persistência. Aroma lembra a champagne, uva verde, levemente ácido e cítrico. Paladar de leve dulçor, amargor residual. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Aftertaste transparece um pouco de figo ,pêssego, acidez leve e de boa persistência.
Bottle. Hazy orange. Nose is interesting, difficult to describe, lightly tart herbal. Tastes similar, quite nice.

Fairly murky carboardy golden, puffy ringed head. Nose is grassy, nutty dark fruit and odd dusty lychee to rain and pineapple. Terse initial taste, berry and bitter. Carbonation is very firm, mouthfeel is itchy enough. Finishes oddly sweet, peppery and stewed melon linger. Bottle, Two Kay Tasting de la Comely Bankers Draught
Nice murky amber colour with a healthy bit of head. Citrus and tropical fruits on the nose, plus some malts. Taste follows nose.

Bottle.
Appearance - cloudy amber golden. Good fluffy head.
Nose - yeast, figs and maybe something like rhubarb.
Taste - more of the same.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - really interesting beer.
Bottle at appellation. Pours hazy orange, nose is citrus, spices, floral, taste is juicy fruit, sweet, floral.
Bottle Appellation Wines, Comely Bankers Draught tasting. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aromas of lemon, spice, fruit. Taste is fruity, spicy, tart finish.
Hazy dark golden with a white head - Fruity aroma - Malt body wsith some acidic fruity flavours - Light fruity finish - This was nice

*Old rating. Best before end 2009.  Malzig, leicht vergoren. Frisch, süffig. Vergorene Trauben (oder Feigen), säuerliches Malz. Voluminös, aber seltsam. Malzig-dunkelfruchtiger Nachgeschmack. Spannend!

750ml bottle. Cloudy amber colour with average, thick, creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Dusty, spicy yeasty aroma, sweet-ish fruity hints of fig and honey, a touch of white pepper, floral overtones. Taste is dry, fruity, notes of fig, a touch of plum and honey, floral overtones, mead resemblance.

How: Bottle..
Where: Tasting 2015-10-09, bought from Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark amber colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Hops, grass, grapefruit, yeast.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Grapefruit, hops, yeast, hops, spices.

Pours unclear amber yellow with a modest white head which soon disappears. Aroma is biscuits. Boy, I sure do hope the taste outperforms the aroma. Taste is syrupy, slight corn, weak sour, moderate conserved fruit sweetness.

Pana obfita, drobna i średnia, całkiem trwała, choć szkła nie zdobi. Barwa pomarańczowa, mętna. Aromat dziki, są nuty stajni, siana, trawy cytrynowej, w tle suszone morele, świeże figi. W smaku kwaskowe, czuć ten sfermentowany sok figowy, przypominający domowej produkcji wino z kwiatów modraka, powtarzają się motywy funky z aromatu, przejrzałe brzoskwinie, mirabelki. Goryczka pestkowo głogowa, nieduża, choć dość długa, potęgowaną lekką cierpkością. Wysycenie wysokie, szampańskie. 
Fajne piwo, lekko dzikie, orzeźwiające, całkiem sesyjne, aczkolwiek brak mi tu większej ilości estrów, owoców, belgijskich nut znanych z Saisonów czy Tripli, ewentualnie amerykańskich chmieli... Możliwe, że refermentacja spowodowała całkowite przetworzenie cukrów resztkowych na alkohol - piwo jest wytrawne, pozbawione słodyczy i wyraźnie rogrzewające, warto byłoby spróbować świeżej warki.

Short white head. Light opaque golden color.
Typical dry Saison aroma.
Fresh pear taste. Low sweetness almost totally dry. Fresh taste.
Low bitterness.
Trübes dunkel orange goldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, dunkle Früchte, Trauben. Geschmack sehr malzig, hefig, Trauben, vergorene Früchte.

Bottle from the Grove, Huddersfield. Wow, this is badass and unusual. The fig flavour is actually kind of light, but somehow this is way more unusual than your average saision. Brown murky with fluffy head. A little musty and funky flavour, and a little lemon. Definite stewed prune/fig vibe. Very smooth. Dry finish. Do try this.
@ Agards väg 5/9-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity with some spices and slightly acidic notes. Body is medium, dry finish.
Tasting @ Gaultier 150905. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and yeasty with spicy notes, sweet, light to medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and spicy.
Tasting @ gaultier. Bottle from systembolaget. Nice beer with bretty and fruity notes. Dry finish
appear redbrown with a small head. light banana aroma, light sour taste, light bitter. lively carbonation. light sour taste

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with nice light brown head. Blaugies pissoir, funky, slight soapy, grassy, zest, grapefruit, some malt. Sweet juice. Juice, sweet dogs, mandarin, yeast, slight soapy and grapefruit soda. Fades bit quickly. Wheaty watery finish. Nice summer refresher!

Kind of a splurge at 12.50 from Nuetnigenough but it was the only place I saw Blaugies beer. Got it to go and drank it along the Saint-Martin Canal. 

In the glass it looks like dense raw organic honey yet has a dense light beige head of foam leaves great sheets of belgian lace costing the glass.

The aroma is complex, this is a saison par excellence: wheat, lemon, pepper a bit of tangy cloves. The taste is light and refreshing, mild tangy lemon, biscuity wheat, white pepper & cloves.

Really nice easy drinking 5.8% I just wished Id opened it when the sun was shining rather than at night. A brewery I will seek out on my next trip to Belgium. Man I didnt get figs from this at all. This was also drunk fairly warm.

0.75l bottle. Hazy deep orange body with a thin white head. Aroma of vinegar, candi sugar, apple cider and some funk. Taste of lemon zest, vinegar and candi sugar. I dont get the figs at all. Interesting beer. Its like a gueuze-faro-saison :-)
Pours hazy golden with a large frothy white head. Aromas of farmhouse, funk, citrus, and figs. Taste is farmhouse, citrus, funk, minerals and figs. Mouthfeel is dry and crisp.

Botte sample from 37.5cl bottle. Hazy blonde golden pour with a white head. Nose of grains, citrus, als dusty hops, cardboard, coriander aswel as Some sweet fruits. A strong medical aceton notes, wich gives it a strange alcohol notice aswel. Not good
750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, thick white head. Sweet aroma, sweet fruit, yeast, hay. Smooth mouthfeel. Mid-sweet taste, dark fruit, hay, yeast, hay, grass. Sweet finish.

On tap at Nedre Foss Gård, july 17th 2015. Hazy golden with a rather big lasting head. Fruity aroma with barnyard. Taste adds peppers and pear, with a sweet chunky taste I believe is the figs. Mild spicy aftertaste. Not sure if Im a fan of fig juice in saisons, but a cool idea.
Nästintill hel klar, gul-lätt orange, guld färgat och snabbt försvinnande skum. Doft: Malt, belgo, parfym,lite jenka, lite syrligt. Smak: Som doft, bara att ta bort lite framför jenka.
Väldigt syrlig men samtidigt rätt uppfriskande. Mycket grumlig och rödbrun. Rätt vid rätt tillfälle.
Bottle @ Grand Tasting, RBSCSG 2015. Hazy golden with a small white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, hops and spices. Medium body with a nice bitter / acid finish.

18.07.2015, 0,75l bottle shared @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish, weeds, sour grass, hay, yeast, minerals, old rope. Taste is slightly fresh sour-ish, soda powder, sour grass, minerals, weeds, old rope, citrus peel, paper. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Fair enough.
Bottle, sample @ RBScSG 15. Hazy dark golden pour with a off white head. Nose has sweet figs, grainy and some yeast. Taste is juicy figs, yeasty, grains and some orange juice.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Hazy amber body with a hay, figs, sulfur, straw and hints of red berries, mild bready tones and strange meaty notes. Taste is strange fruity tones, meat, straw, bread and hints of caramel and red berries. Medium body, high carbonation. Weird, and not completely pleasant, but interesting at least. Hard to rate this one.

Bottle shared with BBGTC. Hazy deep golden body. Aroma is highly sulfury with hints of stables and hay. Taste is light tart with more sulfur. Not quite sure about this but it pairs well with food/cheese. Medium body and co2

Really nice amber hue with a fast setteling beige head. Nose is tart, funky belgian yeast, dark fruits, fresh grass. Flavour is malty sweetness that mixes nicely with the tartness. Yeasty fruits and banana. Bit thin in my opinion but its the first time trying this style. I quite like it.

Bottle at Grand Tasting, RBSCSG 2015 cons 2015-07-11 Göteborg
AR: banan foam, yeasty, sweet - fruit syrup
AP: cloudy - dirty white yellow, no head
F: bananas, yeasty, dry, sweet lemon, wee sour - great mix inbetween the sourness and the bananas
Sample at RBScSG. Hazy golden with white head. Deep sour sweetness with a lot of spices and some dark fruit and ripe fruit. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
0.75l bottle. Amber color with tanned head. Aroma is fruity, cherry with tart character. Taste is tart with some sweetness and fruits. Dry finish. Overall its good and interesting beer.

courtesy of Eliane Münger - hazy dark amber-orange beer with no head retention; light funky with notes of raisins and figs; medium-bodied, light sourish, lively palate, quite dry with long fruity tones of figs and grapes in the finish

750ml bottle. Curious Hop, Otley. Hazy amber. Hard working, fine bubbles, keep alive a thin, dense, lasting white head. Spicy, juicy, yeasty, and fruity, although Id think stone fruit, rather than fig, if I didnt already know. Comes across plummy, and prune like. Taste is tart and light dry. Smooth, easy drinking. Lovely. Disappeared fast.
Bottle, 750 ml from Vrutak, shared with JFK10000. Pours medium orange with white head. Sourish fruity, yeasty, spicy. Light bodied.

Botella . @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Frikicata Gijón 27/06/2015.
BBD: Fin/2016
Color ámbar, aromas dulce, frutal, sabores agrios. Nuevo estilo para mi. Me gusta.

750ml green corked and caged bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy dark orange with a small tan head that reduced quickly leaving no lacing on the glass. Aroma of barnyard, green apples, lemon zest, pears and banana. Flavours of green apples, table grapes, lemon zest and wheat bread. Taste is light sweet and light-medium sour. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Blaugies Bière Darbyste is surprisingly tart and light on sweetness considering the added fig juice, which I could not distinguish in the flavour.
Pours hazy copper with two fingers of off-white head. Aroma of funk, wheat, light bretta. Taste is tarty and fruity with a funky finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Looks lovely orangey with a nice head Theres not much aroma (too cold served?) but the one there is isnt pleasant. Taste is sour, like a gueze or a sour red ale. Maybe its figs, maybe its old socks, hard to tell, but it isnt nice. Not my cup of tea, sorry beer.

37,5cl bottle at home. Nicely cloudy, darkish orange colour topped by a nicely lacing and creamy offwhite head. Cork smells like slivovich, ripe prunes and figs. The ale is nicely balanced between fruity white grapes, dry, slightly acidic, very lightly spicy like clove and pepper. Fizzy carbonation, light body, dry mouthfeel: would qualify as a champagne beer imo.

Sample at Systembolaget. 

Hazy light orange with a white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit and something that reminded of "tutti-frutti". Sweet and with a similar taste. The finish was slightly sour. The body on the thin side. Quite interesting.

Bouteille 75 cl. Conservée couchée et périment fin 2016. 

Gros bruit a l ouverture du bouchon, mais pas d expulsion de bière. Levure active apparemment, premier verre clair léger trouble ensuite. 

Mousse fine qui tombe vite, ou nez ça sent la gueuze et ça va être acide/amer. Mais ça sent bon au dessus du verre. 

En bouche, ça se confirme, mais sans exagération dans aucune direction. On a du fruité abricot, figue et piquant gingembre accompagné de groseille blanche et un petit côté litchi voir longane, aucune astringence ne ferme la bouche, la bière reste super jusque fin de la bouteille, en effet, y avait un fond de levure. 

Une vraie réussite cette bière qui nous sort des sentiers battus.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish aroma, light fruitiness - green apples and light sourness with light spiciness (coriander). Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light caramel, light fruitiness - green apples with faint spiciness. Finish is average, malty - lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness - green apples and light sourness, faint spiciness. Bit thin and too soft/meek. This fig juice just does not work here.

May 16, 2015. Bottle at home. 
Light hazy orange/amber with a quickly dissipating, medium sized, frothy off-white head. Aroma is barnyard, figs, lemon, cellar and hay. Taste is light sweet with light fig notes, barnyard and light citric, finish is more of the citric acidity and barnyard notes with a touch of fruity sweetness. Medium bodied, soft, small bubble carbonation.

750 ml bottle. Pours a veiled and flaky pale amber-golden with a thin, yet resilient, white head. Aroma is oldish, lemon, vanilla and bread. Flavor is oldish, brettish, peach, pear, apple and barn. Finish is lemon, lime, dusty, vanilla and herbs. Lingering funk and tropicalness. Light to medium body, frothy, creamy mouthfeel and average to strong carbonation. Superb!

75cl bottle, no bb - purchased early 2014. Hazy copperbrown cream pour. Caramel barnyard, orchard fruits and nut peel aroma. Did not pick up on the figs until the later half upon pouring of the yeast sediment, a lovely fig milkshake to add what anotherwise tastes like a wilder unfiltered spéciale belge: rounded caramalts, peppery hops, near Franconian in wholesome, rural sessionability. The fig juice adds a nice sweetness this earthy, malt-bodacious saison can well accomodate.

Bière spéciale de 5,8 % abv, avec un ingrédient original puisquil sagit de jus de figue inclus
au brassage. Bouteille de 75 cl bouchonnée de liège. Etiquette rustique.
Couleur ambre moyen tirant sur le caramel.
Clarté nette. Bulles moyennes partout. Mousse blanc cassé bien crémeuse qui tient à 5 mm.
Arômes de blé, poivre, massepain, figue, lard gras, girofle, gueuze, pointe de muscade.
1ère bouche au volume soyeux, sur les céréales avec de la lie de vin, du pain grillé et du
butterscotch. Arrière-bouche en grosses vagues céréales et houblon.
2ème bouche où le fruité passe en avant, avec une texture veloutée (due au froment présent
dans cette bière), bouche assez ample.
3ème bouche où le côté amer et un peu aigre passe en avant, avec de jolies nuances.
Arrière-bouche en complexité, profonde.
Sur la longueur, on peut tester cette bière assez fraîche, mais le déséquilibre est bien là quand 
même. 
Levure salée, poivrée dun niveau pas très élevé.
Alcool correct, même pour les pasteurs !!! (en effet, le nom de cette bière vient de son niveau
dalcool faible qui était bon pour les pasteurs darbystes....)
Finale où on vire au plat : les arômes sont assommés, et larrière-bouche aigre ne révèle plus
de nuances complexes.
Conclusion : une bière de saveurs diverses, oui, donc effectivement une spéciale, mais qui 
présente un très grand manque déquilibre en général et de complexité dans le final  ce qui
constitue 2 très grands défauts. Donc elle est largement surcotée sur ratebeer ...

Pours a hazy, orange-amber color that is topped by well-proportioned, thick, bone colored head. This beer is highly carbonated as can be seen and felt, although the carbonation is nicely soft. The glass gets fully coated with lace with each tip.  Lively but not harsh or aggressive feel, with a semi-dry finish. 

Aroma: Floral and quite fruity with hints of figs, and plums.  Esters suggest a higher ABV than 5.8%.  There is a light spiciness and some earthiness from, I suspect, both hops and yeast.

Taste: Fruity, with a finely mix of sweet and tart plus a faint bitterness.  As I often find in pale Belgians, the taste is notably better than the aroma.  Tart citrus and vague mixed fruits upfront until the finish, with the figs coming out more clearly in the finish and aftertaste.  Hints of banana, white pepper, clove, and nutmeg, but the spiciness is subtle and not due, I believe, to any added spices. This exceptional ale is enticingly complex and dynamic.

O:  This beer is exceptional, with plenty of complexity, great balance, and strong but relatively soft carbonation.

Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of big pear, fig, sour apple, golden raisin, honey, bread, floral, grass, hay, funk, earth, light clove, red wine, and yeast spiciness.  Very nice aromas with good balance, strength, and complexity.  Taste of pear, sour apple, fig, golden raisin, honey, floral, grass, hay, earth, funk, clove, light red wine, and light yeast spiciness.  Fair amount of fruity tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart light fruits, floral, grass, honey, bread, earth, pepper, clove, hay, funk, light red wine, and light yeast spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance and complexity of malt and fruitiness; with a fair amount of funkiness; and zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a fairly slick, lightly syrupy, and slightly acidic mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a damn nice Belgian pale ale!  The fig juice works really well here.  There is a great amount of flavor complexity with nice funk, and good balance; and very smooth to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.

Color arancio con un gradevole cappello di schiuma e quella tonnellata di sedimenti che caretterizzano questo birrificio. Aroma anchesso caratteristico, maltato, legnoso, con una gradevole componente acida. Imbocco originale, dolce, moderatamente carbonata. Di fichi non se ne sente la presenza se non per qualche nota ferrosa. Alla fine emerge di nuovo quella componente acida quasi di brettanomyces. Un birra che ti trasmette una sensazione rurale, di campagna e di artigianato. Birrificio molto, molto intrigante.
Hazy golden nody, floating yeast, white head. Aroma has vinegar, yeast and some strange fruits. Flavour has rubber, metal and red currants.Pretty bad one.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 Draft at Monks. Poured a bright clear gold with a slim foamy white head. Candied amber fruit. Yellow plums. Figs. Golden raisins. Butterscotch. Meyer lemons. Fizzy on the tongue. Lots of honey in the finish. Better on draft than in the bottle, however not so great in older kegs. Fresh is definitely better.

Pours light copper with a huge head that wants to jump straight out of the glass. Aroma is restrained funk, sourness and dust with not so much fruits and spices. Taste is not puckering, really just a soft sour and quite dry. Carbonation level is medium-high enhancing the drinkability of this beer IMO. Not so much fig in the flavor but there is a strange woody (Id describe it as woody) that takes a while to get used to. Would I drink this again? Yes. Would I go out of my way for it? No.

Blaugies continue son travail de fascination.  La Darbyste, dernière bière à boire de cette brasserie coup de cur, se présente sous un aspect voilé avec une robe aux teintes orangées.  La tête mousseuse, riche, sinstalle et reste bien détendue.  Un nez fort intéressant, dominé par la levure et par des arômes fruités.  Que de bons moments olfactifs avec ce côté campagnard propre à la maison et ces parfums de fruits qui dépassent largement celui de la figue.  Des fruits secs, des oranges et des fruits du verger.  En bouche, ne peut-on jamais se plaindre de ces saveurs fruitées et florales, légèrement microbiennes, aigres-douces et même épicées?  Limpression au corps ne déçoit pas.  Le liquide, qui est plutôt mince et animé par un pétillement actif, est hautement perché dans léchelle de la buvabilité.  En finale, une réunion de notes surettes, amères et sèches.  Sans aucun doute une bière singulière épatante.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Tap at Muddy Pig. Hazy golden pour with a spotty white head. Fig and grape, wheat, light, fruity, and easy drinking. Could down several of these.

Bottle, caged and corked.  What a pour!  Golden orange, opaque and hazy, the head is a pure fortress of foam.  The aroma is an out-front attack of flavor -- spicy orange, yeast, and grist.  This is a sweet drink, but built on a classic design; like tropical fruit juice, with a big kick behind it, and a little yeasty flourish.  This is good stuff.  (#4893, 1/6/2013)

Bouteille de 750ml avec bouchon de liège. Bière blonde, jaune-orange avec une belle mousse crémeuse. Le nez est de malt pils, de levure sauvage, touche doxydation. La bouche est gouteuse, levure sauve, léger brett à la manière dun Orval. Superbe. 8/10

POPE, Philly tap ($8): Pours a light orange with a small white head. Aroma is fig, yeast, and barely any hops. Body is extremely light, making this beer very easily drinkable. Figs provide some sweetness. However, I am of the opinion that there was not quite enough flavor, making this beer somewhat forgettable, albeit chuggable.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out a medium cloudy orange colors with big fizzy white head. Tart-yeasty-earthy aromas. Flavor is fruity and bright. Well balanced, almost a bit of tart funk. Flavor of figs is evident.  Finished on the tart, dry side.

75cl bottle @ home shared with Thompson. Clear orange golden color, thick off-white fairly long lasting head. Smell red fruits, sour berries, slightly malts, slightly apple and some yeast. Taste lightly malts, sour berries, lightly sour, lightly yeast and I assume fig juice...though I have no idea what that should taste like. Medium, a bit fizzy carbonation, medium body. Quite nicely balanced imo.

Medium whit foam, which dissapeared quickly. clear golden amber color. nice smell, smells malty unfortunatly little sour also..  Decent taste little sour still nice... Very decent, though nothing special.. Drank at the Benzais place

Bottle (750 ml). Unclear orange with a huge off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is bready with spices, malt, yeast and fruits (maybe the fig juice but its not easily recognizable). Theres some sourness in the taste with malt, yeast and spices. Medium carbonation. Ingredients just doesnt get together. My second beer from them and its a huge deception because La Moneuse was very good... this one is boring and entry-level.

750 ml bottle. BBE 2012. From Belgium. Courtesy of Brandman. HHOKXII.
Lively golden colour with huge frothy white head. 
Saison style yeast, mild Lambic sourness and berries in aroma. 
Berries, yeast, wine and vinegar in flavour. Thin. Some tartness in aftertaste. Not very good.

75cl bottle from Delices et Caprices,Brussels.Shared with Steve.
This poured a hazy golden orange colour with quite a large white head.Sweet and sour aromas of figs and apple.In the taste a slightly sour spicy apple chutney flavour with other fruit/vegetable-like characters in there too.We drank this bottle when it was quite young as per Joris Pattyns suggestion in 100 Belgian Beers,it is a beer we would like to try again as there is quite a lot going on which we couldnt quite decipher on this first tasting ..Dry,hoppy and sour finish.Well worth trying as its so different.
Fig and spice aromas. Floral fig flavors. Very carbonated. Overall a very good saison.

[ASPETTO] 			
giallo carico con riflessi aranciati, velata			
[SCHIUMA]			
bianca, abbondante, fine e buona persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
media intensità, fruttato, con note di uva fresca che ricordano un vino spumoso, miele e cereali, una punta di lieviti e sentori alcolici molto leggeri			
[GUSTO]			
buona intensità, un inizio fruttato con una acidità evidente ma contenuta, in cui spicca un tocco citrico a cui si affianca un amaro leggermente speziato nel finale.

corpo medio, morbida in bocca, carbonazione media, alcolicità leggermente percettibile

ale belga piacevole, ottima per aperitivo, con una acidità moderata ma che conduce la bevuta. Complessivamente fruttata e fresca , ma non ritrovo la componente del succo di figo dichiarato. Ha invece un tocco  che ricorda un vino spumoso, senza però eccedere. una blond ale belga  con un amaro speziato finale evidente che fa il verso da un lato al mondo sour e dallaltro alle witbier.
bottle.   dusty dank dough saison characteristics muddled over by a potent plummy pig juice note.     dirty fig juice took things over in a way that wasnt quite to my liking.  not bad though.
On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY.  Poured a little orange, somewhat hazy.  Crisp with a little bit of spice, but nothing overly memorable about it.
Light hazy golden coloured beer with mediume diminishing white head and lots of carbonation. Fruited hoppy aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is herby sweet ending slight bitter.

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml) Cloudy gold pour with a fizzy white head. Overly sour and slightly skunky aroma. Flavor is bad too. Really bitter and earthy with not much sweetness and definitely no fig juice. Not good.

24/VII/2012 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 2012 - (2012-748) 
Cloudy orange beer, big creamy yellow head, unstable, little adhesive. Aroma: very spicy, thyme, sweet malts, some caramel, bit sugary, some citrus, green apple skin, pie dough. MF: soft carbon, light body. Taste: apple sauce, some lemon, orange peel,bit spicy with a sour touch, reminds me of any random Fantôme beer. :p Aftertaste: bitter and dry, spicy, zesty lemon, bit metallic. Didnt know about the fig juice, didnt taste either (non of 6 beer tasters did).

Bottle @ Tasting. Darker blond coloured beer with lots of carbonation and a medium white head. Light hoppy and short herby hinted aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is fruity and bitter hoppy touched. Medium.
gold blond coloured sparkling body with a white head a spicy malty hoppy aroma a spicy yeasty hoppy malty little sweet bitter taste with a bitter finish

Draft @ When Pigs Fly. Nose was very sweet and fruity. I never would have guessed figs. No real fig flavor or aroma. BUT it was a nice brew. Yeast, sweet malts with a weak sourness in the finish. Maybe a borderline between tart or sour. Light mustiness in the nose. This brew has its own unique thing going on here. It must be the fig juice the brewer uses. Overall impression is; it doesnt make me want to order another however, it was light and refreshing. Quite nice on a warm summer day.
Very special beer. Dry but refreshing, also a little bit sour, maybe because they used figs? Nice traditional product.

Bottle poured into a Blaugies tulip.

Pours a moderate orange color with a white head and a bit of lacing on the way down. The nose carries some strange phenolics and a bit of spice. Light fruit there with a touch of malt. The flavor is similar, and is a bit off-putting. Light-medium body with crisp carbonation. No true yeast or hop character, and what is there isnt all that appetizing. Not a fan.

75cl bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber colour with a nice white head. Quite lasting foam. Aroma is grainy and grassy. Bready and sweetish with some fruitiness. Taste is on the sweet side with limited amount of bitterness. Molasses, red berries and flowers. Fruity sweetness. Tart acidic kick in the finish. Medium body and good carbonation. The acidic kick halos to make this one easy drinkable, considering the quite high sweetness deriving from the figs. Very interesting indeed.

Appearance: cloudy orange with a light airy bubbly head. Swirls bubbly and airy.

Nose: airy, light, and very faint. Digging deep, I discover generic soured fermentation and Brett. Grapes are fleshy then bitter, dry, and tannic with skins, stems, and seeds.

Palate: light and equally mild. Grape flesh in the middle with a disappointingly fast finish. Lightly dry. Thin fig notes.

Final Thoughts: the sour and Brett was a nice touch but overall a mild, thin, and underwhelming beer. I would have liked to both smell and taste more fig and funk.

Not much fig in it but it is detectable. I was looking for a super figgy beer. A very excellent beer. Seems more like a sour or a gueuze. Beautiful color like butterscotch liquid. Lemony tart. Sweetness on the back of the tongue going down.

75cl, 2004 bottle at Kulminator. Pours a golden colour with a lovely thick, tight white head that lasts to the end. A few yeasty floaties. An aroma of figs with some sour notes, a little horse-blanket, some lemon and barley. Flavours similar with figs upfront, tart lemon, caramel and barley again. Moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Nicely tart with a lemony fig linger. I love this beer!
Bottle. Skunk aroma. Funky taste with skunky flavor that ruined this beer for me. I dont know why they use these damned green bottles.
Bottle.  Cloudy amber brown color. Aroma of plums, dates. Taste has dark fruit, dates, slight edge of funk. Ok.

I guess its the figs that give it a very unusual flavor. It has the sourness you would expect along with a bit of funk and then this hard to define essence that is sweet and tart at the same time. Not a very good description but try it if you can.
Draft.  Really refreshing. Yellow, gold color. Yeasty and lemon pineness. A really great example of this style

Tart currant and fig nose. Cloudy copper, fine floaties, thick yellow head. Quite tart, but not as much as I expected. Currant with some surprising wood and cherry accents. Not terribly complex, but perfectly enjoyable without being boring. Tinny, but it kind of works. A very nice sour.
Great strong saison aroma, fierce and robust. Not getting the figs that are supposed to be in here though.

Poured from 750mL corked bottle a hazy golden-orange color with lasting white head and very fine lacing.  Aroma is of fruit, yeast and some spice.  Taste is quite sweet, with some yeast and spice and a mild hoppy bitterness in the end.  Nice carbonation and body.  A nicely done beer, but a little too sweet for my preferences.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2016 75 cl bottle at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Deep orange-amber with a high head. Malty nose with caramel. Fruity, but not exactly figs. Mild, dry, fruity flavor, lots of citrus, with really not much taste of figs. Dry and lemony. Mild and drinkable.
Bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 16.6.2010. Quite fruity and slightly sour Belgian ale.
Draught from GRNYBF Interesting beer...pours gold and very sour, lots of citrusy character

draft. Pours gold with a white head. Yeasty and grainy aroma with some underlying fruity sweetness. The flavor is on the dirty side, with grains and light fruit. Not that good.

Sampled from the tap. Poured a hazy pale golden orange hue white a white head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma was full of flora, fruit and figs with some spice and a sweet grain backbone. Flavor had a good amount of sweet grain with light fruit, fig and spice and a dry finish.

bottle, clear pour 
nose: spiced, cinnamon, fig pudding, dusty potpourri, christmas spice candle, ripe canteloupe, fake lilac, mild bubble gum.
mouth: yuck!  too much hops clashing with the prune juice sweetness of the figs.  round in the mouth, with a nasty, glycerol, slippery texture as well.  theres a disconnect between the moldy mustiness and the perfumey, soapy-sweet fig stuff going on.  reminds me of one of the mikkeller single hops that i really disliked--nasty old shoe liner flavor, flat grape soda with the sugar taken out.

Very good Belgian pale.  On draft at Memphis Taproom for Philly Beer Week.  Pours light copper colored with lingering white head.  Spicy nose light fruitiness.  Well balanced on the palate, typical yeast character for the style.  Very drinkable.
750 ml bottle a cloudy dark orange colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy yeast some fruits and hops flavor malts fruits spicy some sourness and hops

Scotty shot the cork into my ceiling.  How rude.  Pours a brownish color.  Looks to be the same color as an orange mixed with some mud.  Weird.  Has an off white head.  Taste is of some funkalicious fruits.  Bit sour with some tart oranges, figs and carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2011 I think this might have been over carbonated.  I took the cage off and the cork shot off unexpectedly into Arone12s ceiling.  Poured a very hazy pinkish-amber color.  Aroma is very tart with figs and yeast.  Taste is quite complex.  Starts off slightly tart and bitter with fruity notes.  Finish has a very nice sweet fig flavor.  Finish could have used maybe a little bit more of the tart yeast notes.  Very good overall.
750 ml.  Pours an orange copper with a huge dense head.  Fairly light body.  Dry, crisp, sour fig/raisin finish.

500 ml bottle in Germany. Warning, cork explosion, this stuff spewed from the bottle for a good five minutes afterwards as well. Pours a very hazy golden yellowish color with a foamy long lasting white head. The aroma is very hoppy with lemon and saisony type hints to it. A tiny bit of malt comes through the lemons. The flavor comes on with a smooth earthy grassy dirt note that slowly progesses into a figgy hop finish that lingers. Citrus notes are very present through the whole thing. Hmmm not really my style.
Nice fig flavor, a nice tartnesss as well. It had all the signatures of a nice sour saison.

hazy copper color, thin but frothy white head. Nose has fig sugars, orange peel, and a light bitterness. Flavor has more creamy yeast, particularly in finish, bit of fig juice sweetness, heavy lemon and lightly metallic. Zesty carb, light body, very drinkable. Sweetness adds nice balance.
Prune and honey nose, light peach and pepper. Trade is lightly sweet, bei fruity, prunes and plum skins, lots of pepper.

bottle from www.beerplanet.eu
cloudy yellow, large smooth white head.
citrussy aroma, lemongrass, yeast, wheat. resembling a witbier or perhaps a perliner weisse aroma.
yeasty citrussy, faint lemon peel, faint wheat. quite fresh, hoppy bitterness as balance. refreshing.

draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo, NY. Deeper orange pour, nice fluffy white head. fruity aroma, dry yeastiness, mustiness some band aid. Taste was fruity, fig, dry band aid, earthy musiness. Interesting & unique

750ml bottle pours a hazy, orange with a foamy white head.  Gushed.  Nose is tart, floral, honey, orange zest, light raisin.  Flavor has honey, flower petals, light caramel, fresh figs.  Medium bodied, lightly tart.

On tap at Capones, this traditional ale pours clear yellow amber with an orange hue and small off white head. The aroma is light sweetness, but not much else going on. The flavor has some moderate bitterness and sweetness on top of a thin body with some lively carbonation.
Farmhouse-like aroma.  Blood-orange color with slight sudsy white head.  Slightly sour edge, farmhouse ale mustiness...interesting.
21st November 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Crisp beer. Sourish. Caramel and fruit. I guess it must be the figs imparting the sourness. Refreshing. Nice beer!

Draught at Capones:  Aroma of pale malt, Belgian yeast, slight spice, slight dust, and light fruit.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a small, creamy, dense, white head that lasted throughout.  Slightly hazy.  Sparkling.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is heavily sweet and a hint tart.  Tastes of pale malt, grain, Belgian yeast, fig juice, candi sugar, fruit, light funk, slight tartness, and slight banana.  Light to medium body.  Thinish, then slightly sticky texture.  Average carbonation.  Light funk, pale malt, fruit, Belgian yeast, grain, and slight tart finish is heavily sweet and lightly dry.

Deep golden amber pour cloudy beige creamy head ... decent lacing aroma of fruity saison yeast and figs .... taste of figs and fruity saison yeast with a dry oaky peppery taste that flows into a wine like finish .... sweet and dry subtle flavors that are well balanced went well with salmon

Normal service resumed. 750ml corked bottle from Noel Cuveliers. Left the Schaerbeekse in the fridge thinking it might be a bit hardcore for Octo, and this was just a bog standard yeasty blonde...far from it. Foggy orange-amber veiled with sediment under a receding tuft. Funky horse and barrel aroma bursting with lemon, cheesey old hops, wheat sharpness and mildew. Shock of lime juice, hoseblanket and cream cheese with the first sip; lemony acidity mellowing into lovely tangy oak and biscuit notes. Maybe some of that creaminess is the fig, which I would never have dreamt was actually an ingredient. It works seamlessly. Great beer for pussies like me who enjoy the lambic taste but cant handle the hard stuff.

Gusher.  Pulled the cork and beer went everywhere.  Pours hazy orange with thick, fluffy white head.  Aroma is musty.  Taste has light sourness and notes of spices.  Flowery finish.  Different and decent.

Appearance:  cloudy orange caramel with a nice frothy head that lasts awhile; rich lacing.  Aroma:  yeast, raisins and definitely figs, with good fresh-baked bread notes; as it warms, the musty and funky herbal notes shine.  Taste:  sour caramel apples, sweet tart candies; a chewy, beery, wheaty middle; as it warms, some saison-style funk and herbs, with clove in the forefront. Finish: furry, fuzzy on the tongue; the saliva glands went on overdrive; sour and tangy fruit and yeast gives way to a real wheat beer finish.  Notes:  Incredible complex.  Came from rare beer of the month club, and their paper was very helpful in identifying some of the flavors and aromas.  I love lambics, saisons, and Belgian wheat beers.  This beer was like an equal mix between all three styles.  As it warmed, it got even more complex and thats where the saison notes really came out.

37,5cl Bottle @ Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head and lacings. Dry and fruity nose. A bit of caramel and grain. Yeast dominates. Mediun and smooth body/carbonation. OK

From bottle at Poechenellekelder
Appearance : Hazy amber with a huge head

Aroma : Spicy and malty. Wild fruits. Lots of bananas

Taste : Spicy and fruity. Some wild fruits. 

Overall : Interesting beer but according to Joris it was not fresh enough and it can be much better. I guess Ill have to try it again !

On tap at Beachwood BBQ - Seal Beach, CA. Super perfume-like, spicy nose with lots of floral, cologne and fragrance type aromas. Pours a pale-amber-gold, hazy with  lots of clean white head. Flavors are messy to me. Lots of pithy vegetal planty characters, some funky Brett thats got some yeasty off-flavors, and some odd spiced flavors. Its very sweet and astringent to me. The hop flavor is peculiar and earthy. I consider this beer messy and just not all that drinkable.
Pours hazy orangish with a thin mostly receding wispy off-white head. Notes of tart pear, oak, fig, banana, herbal, leather, light caramel, toasted malt. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Extremely dense, hazy body. Effervescent; thick active head. Musty backyard aroma of wet autumn leaves. Medium body. Soft flavor - very mild cheese, light tartness, orange peel. Dusty, yeasty. Very drinkable. This is a fucking bad ass saison.

From the rare beer club. Sampled from a 750 ml green corked bottle this beer poured a very cloudy orange-amber color with a medium sized foamy tan head that produced some lacing. The aroma was faintly sour and tangy with a lemony presence. The flavor was tart, sour and bitter with a Sweettart candy presence and notes of yeast, chalk and lemon. the finish was medium length dry, tart and sour. Medium body. No noticable fig. More of a sour ale than anything else. Ok.

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged from the Rare Beer Club.Amber pour with a short, fizzy tan head. The first thing I smell is A1 steak sauce. Tart fruits, soft floral notes and yeast come through as well. Taste is tart fruit, figs, earthy notes, funky yeast and flowery notes. Body is light-medium, and the carbonation, strong and bubbly. Finishes with more tart fruits, figs, funky yeast notes and dry malts. Rather odd.
bottle, cloudy orange amber in color with tight white foam and lace, sour chalky fig fruity aroma, flavors of sour lemons, fig, pears, floral, bitter finish

7/30/10.  Thanks to Lance for sharing!  Cloudy orange pour with a big fluffy white head that lasts.  Nice funky fresh saison Belgian aroma - spicy, funky, soapy, perfumey, and more.  Tart flavor at first that then fades to light funky saison with an almost faint skunkiness or something.  Not bad!

750ml bottle from 16th St. Liquor in West Vancouver. Dark orange body with a thick foamy white head. Yeasty aroma with some dust, dark cherries and a touch of barnyard as well. Lightly tart, some wheat, cherries and figs. Finishes dry. I detected more cherry flavour rather than figs, but either way this was very enjoyable.

Pour is hazed bright orangey amber with a tight thin skin of an off white head...smell is lightly musty and sweet certainly with pears and some earth fruits...very nice aroma indeed...maybe even some bubble gum...taste is incredibly sweet...definitely fruit juice...some musty flavors as well...grass and leaves with an odd bitterness...Im not quite sure what to make of this, but it is certainly drinkable...lingeringly sweet finish...

Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Thanks to the British/australian guys. 
Clear golden - white head. Sweetness. Yeasty. Phenols. Light hoppy. Prunes notes. A bit plain.
750mL bottle, pours dark orange with a small white head. Aroma of caramel malts, brown sugar, toffee, yeast, some fruits (pear). Flavour of pear, brown sugar and sourness / no sweetness.
Very carbonated. Very unique beer. Lots of dried fruit in nose and palate. Rated 3/23/03
Had this one @ Unofficial Dutch Ratebeer Meeting. Golden, orange colored brew. Yeast, sourness in the aroma. Flavor is malty, pepper, sourness and citrus.
Corked bottle @ UDRM, Oirschot. Figs and a hint of white pepper in the aroma. Dried fruit, citrus and white pepper in the flavor. Sticky mouthfeel. Decent.

Bottle @ Joes RB tasting session. A hazy golden/orange colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of bread with a little sourness. Hints of malt and fruits in the back. The taste is dry bitter, a little sweet with fruits and notes of spices. The aftertaste is dry and bitter.

Bottle at Dutch RB meeting. Pours a clear golden color with a thin white head. The aroma is quite spicy with dominant fruits and some faint brettanomyces. Flavor starts slightly sour and evolves into some bitterness with spices and pepper dominating. Quite watery texture.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2010 Pours a hazy orangeish color with lots of floaties and an enormous head. The armoa is perfectly balanced with some spice, earthiness, and fruitiness. There is also a nice barnyard funk and mild alcohol tinge in the aroma. Flavor is funky an dspicy mildly tart with some fruitiness and some good mineral character.
Draught. Low fluffy lasting off-white head. Hazy dark milky peach aroma. Sweet malty fig aroma and flavor with low carbonation and a short aftertaste.

750 ml bottle. Pours and amber orange body with a small white head. Aroma is sour and fruity with some plum, pear, and grape skin and raspberry. Some stale bready malt in there, too. Flavor is more of the same, sour and vinous. Very dry in the finish with a little tartness lingering. Fig juice but no fig flavor, which would really have provided some needed depth.
Bottle.  Sweet cherry/fig malt aroma.  Hazy amber color with large head.  Sweet fruity (cherry, peach, fig) malt flavor with light bitter finish.  Very nice beer.

(bottle, 75cl) Hazy, amber colour with a mid-sized off-white foamy head. Yeasty, fruit-accented aroma with notes of figues and tangerine, combines with a tinge of herbal spices. Sour and slightly sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Acidic fruity and light to moderately malty taste with shy spicy notes; quite dry and sour-tart fruity finish. Not a perfectly rounded brew. 03.II.10
Cloudy hazy dark amber. Foamy white head. Funky farmhouse aroma. Dry light sourness and big funk. Lemony goodness and funk.

Pours murky amber, with a medium sized tan head. Aroma of caramel, fig, and overripe fruit. Flavor begins with caramel, orange, fig, apricot and mild spice. Finishes with fig and spice. Medium bodied and really drinkable.

Bottle: Amber, cloudy, lots of floaties visible, big fluffy off-white head; sourish-citrussy nose with a tinge of figues; dry bitter-tart and sourish flavour, medium bodied; tart and sourish again in the fruity finish. Not that good....

750ml caged&corked bottle. Pours deep orange and hazy gold with a thick offwhite head. Head fades - but not completely. The aroma is tart and musty with doughy bready qualities. There are notes of lemon acid, slight barnyard funk, light peppery phenols, soft grassiness, and distinct ripe fruit notes (is that the fig?). The flavor starts brisk with a light maltiness and fruitiness with very complex undertones of fruit and sourness. The finish is tart and funky and very dry - like dry white wine. Excellent with food. The mouthfeel is crisp and slippery at the same time. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, a very pleasant beer.

750 ml bottle; had the look out for this one and was happy to see it at Johns Market in Portland; boy, this cork just shot out right before the last turn of the cage; big pop but no gushing; pours clear and dark orange with eggy 2 head into my Boulevard saison glass; aromas of honey, dirty hay, spice, a little wheat and plenty of stale, dry malt; light body with a minty zing and fizzy fruitiness; has a little yeasty spice and reminding me slightly of the recently drunk Schlafly Bière de Garde, but with much more punch; honey, yeast and oranges with an almost brett zing; very dry with a thin apple juice kind of texture and sweetness; tart green apples become more pronounced deeper in the bottle and overall flavor becomes more odd and unpleasant

From a 75 cl bottle, quit some sediment in the bottom of the bottle. Hazy amber beer with small off white foam. Aroma is fruity, yeasty, peppery
and smooth. Taste of caramel with dry cereals some honey and hints of fruits, end with an earthy bitterniss of hops.

Bottle.   Pours a brune body with an off white head.  Yeast y fruity notes, figs, some plum, and caramel notes.  A bit artificial and spritz y, still overall its decent, the body is thin and the flavor is short lived.

Bottle from Greens in Atlanta.  Aroma was not what I expected.  I smelled a bit of fig/raisin/date along with some yeast and tart vinous notes.  Flavor is quite tart and the fruit kind of got lost in the tartness and yeasty characterstics.  Just ok.

It poured a hazy brown-orange liquid with a small foam that stayed. It also had allot of yeast floating around. It smelled a bit like wine, with some yeast and alcohol. The flavor was similar with wine, yeast and some fruit. However it was bland and a bit boring.

37,5ml Bottle at Akkurat.
Pours orange hazy with a big thick head.
Fruity sour aroma.
Tastes a bit like soda, sour but not as sour as the aroma implies.
Bottle. Small sourness. Fruity. Very sweet. Drinkable like a soda. Interesting.

750mL bottle. Pours murky amber, capped with a medium sized tan head. Aroma of caramel, fig, and overripe fruit. Flavor begins with caramel, orange, fig, apricot and mild spice. Finishes with fig and spice. Medium bodied and really drinkable. This sat in my fridge for a while because i was afraid I wouldnt like it, but it turned out to be really enjoyable.

Appearance: Pours a hazed, dark amber body with a fizzy, white head thats a bit on the small side. Light effervescence.

Smell: Lightly toasted Belgian malts, fresh spices, and various other fruits try their best to compete with the particularly strong fig juice scent.

Taste: Lightly toasted maltiness with a slight hint of caramel candy. A slug of fig juice alongside a small touch of acidity. Also sliced pears and a slow drop of citrus oil. Herbaceous spiciness and thin vein of funk at the midpoint. Herbal, floral hops with only a small, small amount of bitterness. Finishes dry, spicy, and fruity.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Moderate carbonation.

Drinkability: Worth a try. Interesting and fairly enjoyable. Hope you like figs!

2005 bottle, courtesy SoLan.  The brittle old cage broke when I twisted the wire, and if it were not for a fast and ready thumb the cork would have likely hit the ceiling.  The brew pours a crystal clear, pure, dark amber color with effervescing, Champagne-like bubble streams.  A thin, ultra-smooth blanket of cream colored foam settles in at the surface.  Wet lacing forms big, drooping arches.  Aromas include a dry caramel malt base, with notes of fig, dried prune, and raisin lending deep, concentrated, fruity sweetness.  Scents of day old bread, funked-out, earthy oak, peppery spice, and faded floral hopping complete the unique and complex nose.  The flavor is very dusty and wrought with wild yeast, earthy as can be, with tart, almost sour, fruity overtones.  I must say that the combination comes off as being a bit plastic-like, but that might very well be due to the advanced age of this particular beer.  Fig and golden raisin again show quite prominently.  The palate is medium bodied, dry, and lively effervescent.  This is a weird one.  Not bad....just weird.
